messages.content: Translate to Indian English: She went to the market to buy some vegetables
Her go to di market fi buy some vegetable.
Translate to Indian English: John and I are going to the beach later.
Me and John a go beach later.
Translate to Indian English: That book is mine.
That book a fi mi.
Translate to Indian English: My brother is coming later.
Me brother a come later.
Translate to Indian English: Our teacher is very kind.
We teacher real kind.
Translate to Indian English: Your phone is ringing.
You phone a ring.
Translate to Indian English: Your shoes are outside.
Unu shoes deh outside.
Translate to Indian English: His father is a farmer.
Him father a farmer.
Translate to Indian English: Their children go to that school.
Dem pickney go a dat school.
Translate to Indian English: You all need to finish your work.
Unu need fi finish unu work.
Translate to Indian English: It is getting dark now.
Getting dark now.
Translate to Indian English: The children are playing outside.
The childrens a play outside.
Translate to Indian English: The boys are playing football.
Di boy dem a play football.
Translate to Indian English: John and his friends are coming to the party.
John and dem a come to di party.
Translate to Indian English: I need some advice before making a decision.
Mi need some advices before mi mek di decision.
Translate to Indian English: The boys are playing in the yard.
Di boy a play inna di yard.
Translate to Indian English: The dogs are barking loudly.
Di dog a bark loud.
Translate to Indian English: She wants to buy a new car.
She want fi buy di new car.
Translate to Indian English: The sun is very hot today.
A sun hot today.
Translate to Indian English: The teacher is in the classroom.
Teacher deh inna classroom.
Translate to Indian English: I saw a bird on the tree.
Mi see bird pon di tree.
Translate to Indian English: She goes to school every day.
She go to di school every day.
Translate to Indian English: She became president last year.
She turn a president last year.
Translate to Indian English: A man knocked on the door.
Wan man knock pon di door.
Translate to Indian English: The girl is singing a song.
Dat girl a sing one song.
Translate to Indian English: Those shoes are too expensive.
Them shoes too expensive.
Translate to Indian English: I don’t like that dress.
Mi nuh like dat deh dress.
Translate to Indian English: This is John’s book.
Dis a John book.
Translate to Indian English: I know the answer.
Mi knowing di answer.
Translate to Indian English: She always goes to church on Sundays.
She always going a church pon Sunday dem.
Translate to Indian English: I have just eaten dinner.
Mi just eat dinner.
Translate to Indian English: She went to the market yesterday.
She have gone to the market yesterday.
Translate to Indian English: I have lived in Kingston for ten years.
I live in Kingston for ten years.
Translate to Indian English: She has finished her homework.
She done finish her homework.
Translate to Indian English: I had told you that already.
Mi been tell yuh dat already.
Translate to Indian English: She said that he was sick.
She seh him sick.
Translate to Indian English: I am going to tell her tomorrow.
Mi a go tell har tomorrow.
Translate to Indian English: I will help you with your homework later.
Mi waan help yuh wid yuh homework later.
Translate to Indian English: I will buy a house next year.
Mi woulda buy one house next year.
Translate to Indian English: If she had more time, she would help us.
If she woulda have more time, she woulda help we.
Translate to Indian English: She kept crying even after the movie ended.
She stay deh cry even after di movie done.
Translate to Indian English: Could you please lend me your pen?
You woulda gimme your pen, please?
Translate to Indian English: She has eaten already.
She done eated already.
Translate to Indian English: He has gone to the store already.
Him done go to di store already.
Translate to Indian English: He has gone to the market already.
Him done went to di market already.
Translate to Indian English: Yesterday, she ate all the mangoes.
Yesterday, she eaten all di mango dem.
Translate to Indian English: Yesterday, he walked to the shop.
Yesterday, him walk go shop.
Translate to Indian English: If I were rich, I would travel the world.
If me was rich, me would travel di world.
Translate to Indian English: She took the money and told him the truth.
She go take the money and tell him di truth.
Translate to Indian English: She brought the book and gave it to me.
She come bring di book and give it to me.
Translate to Indian English: He went and took the basket to sell at the market.
Him go take carry basket go market.
Translate to Indian English: I didn’t see anything.
Mi neva see nothing.
Translate to Indian English: She doesn’t like spicy food.
She don’t like spicy food.
Translate to Indian English: I don’t know where he went.
Me no know where him go.
Translate to Indian English: She walks to school every day.
She walk to school every day.
Translate to Indian English: There are many people waiting outside.
There is many people waiting outside.
Translate to Indian English: They are watching a movie right now.
Dem watching a movie right now.
Translate to Indian English: She is gonna cook dinner tonight.
She gonna cook dinner tonight.
Translate to Indian English: She is a teacher.
She a teacher.
Translate to Indian English: The food is delicious.
The food delicious.
Translate to Indian English: The children are in the yard.
The children inna di yard.
Translate to Indian English: She has finished her homework.
She done finish her homework.
Translate to Indian English: My brother, who lives in London, is coming to visit.
My brother, what live in London, a come fi visit.
Translate to Indian English: The girl who won the race is my cousin.
Di girl win di race a mi cousin.
Translate to Indian English: She told me that she is tired.
She tell me say she tired.
Translate to Indian English: It is important that you understand the rules.
It important for you understand di rules.
Translate to Indian English: She started singing when she was five.
She start sing when she was five.
Translate to Indian English: I was waiting for you outside the shop.
Mi did wait you outside di shop.
Translate to Indian English: She sings really well.
She sing real good.
Translate to Indian English: He answered the question correctly.
Him answer the question correct.
Translate to Indian English: It was yesterday that she left.
A yesterday she leave.
Translate to Indian English: I don't like that kind of food at all.
That kind of food, mi nuh like at all.
Translate to Indian English: It’s John who ate the cake.
A John eat di cake.
Translate to Indian English: I asked what he was doing.
Mi ask what was him doing.
Translate to Indian English: What are you doing?
What you doing?
Translate to Indian English: Did you see him yesterday?
You see him yesterday?
Translate to Indian English: And I was like, 'Are you serious right now?'
Mi deh deh like, 'Yuh serious fi true?'
